items.synopsis: The Israeli Defence Forces say they're fighting at "about seven or eight" locations near Gaza in an attempt to "establish security". Follow live.

title.children: Israel is working 'to establish security' in wake of attacks by Hamas

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: We're getting some new lines out of Israel that answer some of the lingering questions we've had about the situation on the ground. We'll bring you more information when we have it, but in summary, the Israeli Defence Forces has said: Israel is still fighting 'at about seven to eight' locations near Gaza Some Hamas 'infiiltrators' are still able to enter Israel The military believes 'dozens' of Israelis are being held captive in Gaza Four 'combat divisions' have been deployed to southern Israel, but it's taking longer than expected to 'establish security' Reuters
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Israel is still working to 'establish security'

children.content: We're getting some new lines out of Israel that answer some of the lingering questions we've had about the situation on the ground.
We'll bring you more information when we have it, but in summary, the Israeli Defence Forces has said:
Israel is still fighting 'at about seven to eight' locations near Gaza
Some Hamas 'infiiltrators' are still able to enter Israel
The military believes 'dozens' of Israelis are being held captive in Gaza
Four 'combat divisions' have been deployed to southern Israel, but it's taking longer than expected to 'establish security'
Israel has deployed combat units and reservists to the border region.
(Reuters: Ammar Awad)
Reuters

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Akram Al Satarri lives in Gaza with his family and said he works as a journalist. He told ABC Radio Melbourne earlier today he believed the conflict was different this time. "We have lived a very long time under occupation," he said. "The way the Palestinian resistance factions are moving ... the way they are dealing with the Israeli army, it shows some dynamics are changing. "It shows some sort of solution must be found to find a just solution for the chronic crisis and bottlenecks that the people of Gaza and Palestine have been living." Mr Al Satarri said the bodies of people he knew were being retrieved from the rubble from strikes on Gaza. "I don't think anyone in Gaza is safe. There are no guarantees anyone in Gaza will survive," he said. "The sounds of explosions are everywhere – wherever you go, you will hear them." He said there was already a severe shortage of food, with the Israeli government blocking supplies from reaching the Gaza Strip after the attack by Hamas.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: 'Some dynamics are changing': Report from inside Gaza

children.content: Akram Al Satarri lives in Gaza with his family and said he works as a journalist.
He told ABC Radio Melbourne earlier today he believed the conflict was different this time.
"We have lived a very long time under occupation," he said.
"The way the Palestinian resistance factions are moving ... the way they are dealing with the Israeli army, it shows some dynamics are changing.
"It shows some sort of solution must be found to find a just solution for the chronic crisis and bottlenecks that the people of Gaza and Palestine have been living."
Mr Al Satarri said the bodies of people he knew were being retrieved from the rubble from strikes on Gaza.
"I don't think anyone in Gaza is safe. There are no guarantees anyone in Gaza will survive," he said.
"The sounds of explosions are everywhere – wherever you go, you will hear them."
He said there was already a severe shortage of food, with the Israeli government blocking supplies from reaching the Gaza Strip after the attack by Hamas.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: There are 100,000 Israeli reserve troops gathered in southern Israel "preparing to execute the task that the Israeli Government has designated the Israeli military to do", according to IDF spokesperson Jonathan Conricus. In a video posted to the IDF X account, Conricus said: "Our job is to make sure that at the end of this war, Hamas will no longer have any military capability to threatens Israelis civilians with." "And in addition to that, we are to also make sure Hamas will not be able to govern the Gaza Strip." Yesterday, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said his security cabinet had made the decision to destroy Hamas’s ability to govern in a way that posed a threat to Israeli civilians.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Israel amasses 100,000 reservists in Gaza border region: IDF spokesperson

children.content: There are 100,000 Israeli reserve troops gathered in southern Israel "preparing to execute the task that the Israeli Government has designated the Israeli military to do", according to IDF spokesperson Jonathan Conricus.
In a video posted to the IDF X account, Conricus said: "Our job is to make sure that at the end of this war, Hamas will no longer have any military capability to threatens Israelis civilians with."
"And in addition to that, we are to also make sure Hamas will not be able to govern the Gaza Strip."
Yesterday, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said his security cabinet had made the decision to destroy Hamas’s ability to govern in a way that posed a threat to Israeli civilians.
